ratings.comment: Greatest professor I've ever had and it's not even close. Was a philosophy major before this class, a calc major now. If her section is open TAKE THIS CLASS. Take it twice if you can. Lectures are incredibly thoughtful, efficient, and inspirational. Finds a way to make exams enjoyable and challenging at the same time. LOVE HER.
She is a good teacher but may be harsh for lower-lever materials. If you are serious about mathematics and want to do more than mandatory courses, definitely go with her classes.

If you feel comfortable teaching yourself the material, then feel free to take her class. Stopped going to lecture halfway through the semester because she is about as useful an instructor as a potted plant. Clearly intelligent, might be good in an upper level math class with few students. Barring that, AVOID. Teaches computations, tests theory.

I once counted the number of times Melanie said "Um" and had to flip the page after a nice, hefty tally of 171 um's in 30 minutes. I was so exhausted after such hard work that I left. Most work I ever did in Melanie's class.
Terrible lecturer avoid class

Very confusing, unorganized lectures with a lot of "um... you know.. um..." and unnecessary, long-winded paragraphs writted on the board. Unreasonable exams that ask you to explain mathematical theory in words. Unreasonable grading, almost no partial credit given. Unbelievable that I'm going into debt because of this.

Its the age old question- why am I paying $20,000+ just to get absolutely awful teaching?  No social skills, seems to resent when students ask questions, comes to class in glorified pajamas, and expects way too much even for the difficulty calc 2 already is.

"For example, I have never liked calculus, which is a subject most advanced students learn at the end of high school. I didn’t like it then, and I still don’t like it now, and I am on my way to becoming a professional mathematician." ~Melanie Matchett Wood (UW Calculus professor?)

Professor Wood's lectures are dry and make no attempt at engaging the students.  Her social skills are non-existant and Melanie often becomes hostile towards students when approached with questions.  The University of Wisconsin needs to step in and take action.
Awful professor! Her midterms have a beautiful average of 48%. She utters umm all the time and has an irritating voice. AVOID HER

She is so bad at teaching that it makes going to class a dreadful event. I have never met someone with less social skills than her. I feel bad for anyone that needs to take the course and is stuck with her. When the average on the exam is less than 50% there's a problem. Avoid her at all costs.

Theoretical mathematician. Even if you plan on never using any mathematical calculations in your career, do not take this class. She is an awful lecturer, writes irritating tests, and the University gives a poor excuse of a book to use. If stuck with her, find a good TA or different prof to talk to for help. Avoid her.

Disrespectful to students and overall a terrible lecturer. Made the class much more difficult than it needs to be. If you are not already confident with Calculus definitely avoid this professor! If you are a good test taker it is easy to beat the curve and do well. She also refused to plan an alternate final exam time for students who required one.

She's a theoretical mathematicians- she likes discussing theories and concepts rather than the final answer. Generally, students would expect more calculations rather than "explaining the calculations". Not your typical calc class- personally; hard, confusing, frustrating, helpless. She's used to teach higher level math.

after midterm 1 I only went to lecture twice and I even got a better grade on midterm 2. Her lectures are irritating and I'd rather just go to discussion. The positive part is if you have her class you just do whatever and No Pressure. You can count on your fellow students will fail the exams as you so you can pass the class

You will learn more from a broken lamp than you will from Melanie Wood. She probably couldn't teach herself the material. Unorganized, speaks incoherently, and exams are impossible with an average of about 47 percent. Avoid this teacher at all costs!

She might be the worst teacher I have ever had in college thus far. She goes off on tangents in class that leave you less knowledgable than when you arrived. Her test are completely different from everything she teaches and assigns for homework. She has degrees from both Stanford and Princeton, yet does not know how to teach whatsoever. DO NOT TAKE

First off, if you like learning on your own take Melanie's 222 class because that is what you will need to do if you want to get a decent grade. Absolutely terrible speaker, to the point of annoyance. I really wanted to like her, but she makes it near impossible. DO NOT TAKE HER COURSE.... Ever.

Disrespectful to students, nervous during lecture, makes frequent mistakes, has incredibly tough exams that do not test the student's knowledge well, mutters and stutters during lecture almost to the point of being unintelligible. Often I am confused as to how she passed high school English, let alone got a PhD
Shout out to Melanie for being the most Matchett professor at the UW.

She is very unclear and terrible at explaining things, its as simple as that.  Yes, the course material is difficult in and of itself but she makes it unnecessarily hard.  The class averages on the exams are all under 50% (usually upper 40's).  Is is curved(obviously) but it is still ridiculous IMO.

She just too focused on conceptual things and she made exams that are so hard that most students could not finish on time, in this case "on time" does not mean the ones that are finished are correct. She is just terrible. Never take her class unless u wanna suffer throughout the semester. And her voice is very very irritating.

With a background like hers (princeton and stanford) youd think she'd be almost overqualified to teach second semester calc. Far from it. She should've put some time into learning to speak like a normal human being and doing examples that are actually relevant the the class. Avoid at all costs. Her exams make no sense and she even confuses the TAs.
Really unclear during lectures, horrible at teaching, and IS THE worst teacher I have ever had.
Horrible teacher. Exams are ridiculous and not relevant to the material at all.

Honestly the worst professor I ever had. Basically she doesn't care about teaching and whether if the students understand the material or not. She's just here to do her research. Her exams don't even test us on the material we learned in class and her teaching style is just horrible. Avoid her!

I came into this class with math being my favorite subject. During lecture, she seems very unorganized, very judgmental about questions, and disengaged overall. TA's do not even understand her. Exams are ridiculous even for people who understand the material (47% avg). Calc 2 is already a challenging course, but Melanie Wood makes it unbearable.

Irritating voice, says umm every other word, goes through an example halfway and tells us to figure out the rest on our own time even though we haven't learned it, does this while skipping steps and writing illegibly, won't answer anyone's questions, exam based on stuff we never went over in class, maybe 1-2 calculus problems. The worst prof ever!

She's definitely the worst. I don't like her lectures because she pants from time to time and it seems that she s going to faint while some other times she got so hype for no reason.exams? Worst possible. Only one legit question in my opinion. I can't complain enough

WORST teacher I have ever met from my kindergarten to university!!!  Listening to lecture is a waste of time and examination is REALLY bizarre. Voice make listener sleepy and unrelevant stuff full of the blackboard.
Her exam is hard and its not easy to get an A. Her logic is confusing too, write many irrelevant stuffs on the board. I'd say try to avoid her.

NEVER! NEVER! Take this professor's class. Her voice is irritating. Make us sleepy and hard to focus.Not helpful at all. Visiting TA would be the better choice. Exam is awful. What we have learned in lecture and discussion is almost useless. TA gives us review sheet, but it is not helpful at all. Make effort useless. You need innate talent to ace.

She waste a large amount of time during lecture; She gives confusing questions during exam; She deducts as much scores as possible from students with an average score of below 50. Do not take her class!
How can you give this professor an average quality??! Because you got an A ? To be objective, she tried to teach well, but apparently she didn't.
Terrible !!!
bad
Extremely Awful!! DO NOT take her class! My TA is much better...
Extremely awful! DO NOT take this professor's class. My TA is much better.
The worst math professor ever! Sleepy voice with terrible exams. Nobody could understand what she said.

TERRIBLE "professor!!!" I have resorted to using Khan Academy and other resources to teach myself the course material because she doesn't teach. She shows up to class looking like she just rolled out of bed. Her appearance and overall approach to "teaching" this course is very unprofessional and I found it impossible to learn from her!!

Don't take this math teacher!! She goes off on tangents that not only distract form the lesson at hand but lead the student to having to do all the work.  Not only do I now attend a different lecture instead of hers but spend several hours a week trying to catch up to where other Calc 2 classes are at. Never take Math 222 with this "teacher"
